title: How to Sew a Baby Hat With Ears

steps.headline: Lay your chosen fabric out on a flat surface, make a series of marks 36 centimeter (14.2 in) in from the straight edge, and another series of marks 25 centimeter (9.8 in) up from the bottom edge.
steps.description: Cut along the marks leaving you with a rectangle of fabric.

steps.headline: Fold the rectangle in half lengthways.
steps.description: Hold the edges together by inserting pins at right angles, this will make it easier to remove the pins as you sew.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f1\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_04_105.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f1\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_04_105.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":328,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":542.1333333333333,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Set your machine on a running stitch. Sew a seam roughly 1 centimeter (0.4 in) in from the edge, running a few stitches back and forth at either end will seal the seams. Trim away any excess thread.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/de\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_05_874.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/de\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_05_874.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":328,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":542.1333333333333,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears<\/a> - Shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pin together the top edges of the fabric, and sew a seam 1 centimeter (0.4 in) in, just as before. You have now created the basic hat shape.

steps.headline: Cut off the top corners taking care not to cut through the seam.
steps.description: This will stop the final ear shape from looking too bulky.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_07_761.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_07_761.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":324,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":534.5333333333333,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears<\/a> - Shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Turn the hat inside out. Use a pin to pull the corners all the way out.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/02\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_08_87.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/02\/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_08_87.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.0666666666667,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears<\/a> - Shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Make a series of marks 1 centimeter (0.4 in) up from the bottom of the hat, fold the fabric up to that mark and press with iron to hold the crease.

steps.headline: Turn up another 7 centimeter (2.8 in) to create a deep hem, and press again.
steps.description: Pin in place and sew all the way around.

steps.headline: Pinch a corner together to form an ear shape, play around with it a bit to get the look you want.
steps.description: hand sew a couple of stitches to hold in place. Do exactly the same with the second ear.

steps.headline: Place on your baby,stand back,and admire your handiwork!

text:
Lay your chosen fabric out on a flat surface, make a series of marks 36 centimeter (14.2 in) in from the straight edge, and another series of marks 25 centimeter (9.8 in) up from the bottom edge. Cut along the marks leaving you with a rectangle of fabric. Fold the rectangle in half lengthways. Hold the edges together by inserting pins at right angles, this will make it easier to remove the pins as you sew. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f1/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_04_105.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f1/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_04_105.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":328,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":542.1333333333333,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears - Shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Set your machine on a running stitch. Sew a seam roughly 1 centimeter (0.4 in) in from the edge, running a few stitches back and forth at either end will seal the seams. Trim away any excess thread. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/de/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_05_874.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/de/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_05_874.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":328,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":542.1333333333333,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears - Shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Pin together the top edges of the fabric, and sew a seam 1 centimeter (0.4 in) in, just as before. You have now created the basic hat shape. Cut off the top corners taking care not to cut through the seam. This will stop the final ear shape from looking too bulky. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/9c/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_07_761.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/9c/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_07_761.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":324,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":534.5333333333333,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears - Shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Turn the hat inside out. Use a pin to pull the corners all the way out. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/02/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_08_87.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/02/How-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears_08_87.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.0666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-sew-a-baby-hat-with-ears - Shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Make a series of marks 1 centimeter (0.4 in) up from the bottom of the hat, fold the fabric up to that mark and press with iron to hold the crease. Turn up another 7 centimeter (2.8 in) to create a deep hem, and press again. Pin in place and sew all the way around. Pinch a corner together to form an ear shape, play around with it a bit to get the look you want. hand sew a couple of stitches to hold in place. Do exactly the same with the second ear. Place on your baby,stand back,and admire your handiwork!
